intro: Papaver amurense, commonly known as the Korean poppy, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to East Asia. It features striking, bright red to orange petals that surround a central cluster of stamens. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are alternate and hairy. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or mountainous regions. The flowers bloom in spring, adding vibrant color to its natural habitat.
